citation.abstract:
To study the performance of the rapid chromogenic βLACTA test for the rapid detection of expanded-spectrum cephalosporin (ESC) nonsusceptibility among Enterobacteriaceae, in a region endemic for potent β-lactamases.
The βLACTA test was applied prospectively on 235 consecutive Enterobacteriaceae clinical isolates and163 previously characterized ESC-nonsusceptible Enterobacteriaceae producing a range of β-lactamases.
βLACTA exhibited excellent sensitivity (96.1%)/specificity (98.5%) for the detection of ESC nonsusceptibility in the 235 clinical isolates, which harbored mainly ESBL/KPC/NDM enzymes. Among the 163 challenged archived isolates, some false-negative or uninterpretable results were detected mostly among ESC-nonsusceptible isolates with AmpC/VIM/OXA-48-like enzymes.
βLACTA may be effectively applied in regions where ESC nonsusceptibility among Enterobacteriaceae is mainly due to ESBL, KPC or NDM β-lactamases.
citation.title: Performance of the βLACTA test for rapid detection of expanded-spectrum cephalosporin-nonsusceptible  Enterobacteriaceae
